title: Sri Lanka violence kills 08, 102 properties damaged
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka violence which came after loyalists of ex-Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa attacked a site of peaceful protestors in the capital had killed 08 persons and over 100 houses had been damaged or torched, police said
Violent mobs attacked a property during the nigh of May 09 despite a curfew being imposed.

Temple Trees, the official residence of the Prime Minister was place under seige by thousands of protestors on the night of May 09 and vehicles which brought supporters were torched and toppled to a nearby lake.
